source.name: Merkle Tree 02-structure
source.instructions: 下面哪一项最准确的描述了默克尔树的结构？

answers.answer: 一个二叉树（每一个节点都不超过两个子节点的数据结构），这个二叉树中，每一个非叶子节点都是它的两个子节点的哈希值。
一个链表数据结构，这个链表中，每一个数据节点都包含前一个数据节点的哈希值。
一个二叉树，这个二叉树中所有的节点都包含交易数据和这个交易数据的哈希值。
一个扁平，线性的数据结构，就像数组。

source.guidance:
The correct answer is "A binary tree (a data structure where each node has no more than 2 child nodes) where each non-leaf node is the hash of its two child nodes". 

This accurately describes the structure of a Merkle Tree as presented in the topic. In a Merkle Tree, leaf nodes contain hashes of data blocks (not the actual data), and each non-leaf node is the hash of its child nodes' hashes. 

The other options are incorrect: A Merkle Tree is a Tree data structure, and not a linked list. Nodes in a Merkle Tree do not contain both data and hashes (only leaf nodes contain data hashes, while parent nodes contain hashes of their child node hashes).
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT identify the structure and properties of a Merkle Tree
